intro: Lamyra hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish lamyra, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny locations. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale blue to white ray flowers. Lamyra hispanica is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline and dry conditions.
